workflow.name: AI-powered candidate nurturing with scheduled WhatsApp & Gmail follow-ups
workflow.description:
## What This Workflow Does

This workflow automates the candidate nurturing process, solving the common problem of candidates losing interest or "ghosting" after an application. It keeps them engaged and informed by sending a personalized, multi-channel (WhatsApp & Gmail) sequence of follow-up messages over their first week.

The automation triggers when a new candidate is added to your ATS (e.g., via a Recrutei webhook). It then uses AI to generate a custom 3-part message (for Day 1, Day 3, and Day 7) tailored to the candidate's age and the specific job they applied for, ensuring a professional and empathetic experience that strengthens your employer brand.

## How it Works

1.  **Trigger:** A Webhook node captures the new candidate data from your Applicant Tracking System (ATS) or form.
2.  **Data Preparation:** Two Code nodes clean the incoming data. The first (`Separating information`) extracts key fields and formats the phone number. The second (`Extract age`) calculates the candidate's age from their birthday to be used by the AI.
3.  **AI Content Generation:** The workflow sends the candidate's details (name, age, job title) to an AI model (`AI Recruitment Assistant`). The AI has a detailed system prompt to generate three distinct messages for Day 1 (Thank You), Day 3 (Friendly Reminder), and Day 7 (Final Reinforcement), adapting its tone based on the candidate's age.
4.  **Split Messages:** A Code node (`Separating messages per days`) receives the single text block from the AI and splits it into three separate variables (`day1`, `day3`, `day7`).
5.  **Day 1 Send:** The workflow immediately sends the `day1` message via both Gmail and WhatsApp (configured for Evolution API).
6.  **Day 3 Send:** A "Wait" node pauses the workflow for 2 days, after which it sends the `day3` message.
7.  **Day 7 Send:** Another "Wait" node pauses for 4 more days, then sends the final `day7` message, completing the 7-day nurturing sequence.

## Setup Instructions

This workflow is plug-and-play once you configure the following 5 steps:

1.  **Webhook Node:** Copy the **Test URL** from the Webhook node and configure it in your ATS (e.g., Recrutei) or form builder to trigger whenever a new candidate is added. Run one test submission to make the data structure visible to n8n.
2.  **AI Credentials:** In the `AI Recruitment Assistant` node, select or create your OpenAI API credential.
3.  **MCP Credential (Optional):** If you use a Recrutei MCP, paste your endpoint URL into the `MCP Recrutei` node.
4.  **Gmail Credentials:** In all three `Message Gmail` nodes (Day 1, 3, 7), select or create your Gmail (OAuth2) credential.
    * *Optional:* In the same nodes, go to **Options** and change the `Sender Name` from `your_company` to your actual company name.
5.  **WhatsApp (Evolution API):** This template is pre-configured for the Evolution API. In all three `Message WhatsApp` nodes (Day 1, 3, 7), you must:
    * **URL:** Replace `{server-url}` and `{instance}` with your Evolution API details.
    * **Headers:** In the "Header Parameters" section, replace `your_api_key` with your actual Evolution API key.

workflow.name: Candidate Nurturing Automation & Multi-Channel Follow-Up Flow

tags.name: Candidate Nurturing Automation & Multi-Channel Follow-Up Flow

nodes.name: No Operation, do nothing
nodes.notes: Your workflow has reach the end, you can costumize however you want

parameters.content:
## How it works

This workflow receives candidate data through a Recrutei Webhook, cleans the information, extracts the candidateâ€™s age when available, and sends these details to an AI model to generate three nurturing messages (Day 1, Day 3, Day 7).
The resulting text is split into separate messages, and each one is scheduled for delivery using timed waits. After each wait period, the workflow sends the appropriate message through WhatsApp and Gmail.
Everything runs automatically once the webhook receives the initial payload.

## Setup steps

Configure the Webhook node and test it once to initialize data.
- In Separating information, confirm the field mappings match your incoming payload.
- In Extract age, ensure the birthday format matches your source system.
- In Message Model, add your API credentials and connect to the MCP tool.
- In Getting the AI content, set the model, prompt, and input variables.
- For WhatsApp and Gmail nodes, authenticate both accounts and fill in sender details.
- Adjust wait durations if your nurturing schedule changes.
- Run a full test with a dummy candidate to confirm message flow and timing.

## Input & Data Preparation
This section receives the webhook payload, extracts the relevant candidate fields, cleans the data, and calculates age when available.

## AI Generation & Message Split
Here the workflow sends candidate + job data to the AI model and receives the 3 nurturing messages in a single string.

values.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in recruitment communication.
Your objective is to create exactly three nurturing messages, in plain text, for candidates who applied to a job opening.

The messages must follow this schedule:

Day 1: thank-you and reinforcement of the companyâ€™s interest.

Day 3: friendly reminder reinforcing that the process is still active and highlighting one benefit of the role.

Day 7: final reinforcement, inviting the candidate to stay attentive and showing that the company values their application.

MANDATORY RULES

Use ONLY the candidate data provided by the user.

Never query MCP for candidates.

The candidate always exists.

Personal data comes only from the user prompt.

You may query MCP ONLY for vacancy/job information.

MANDATORY AND INFLEXIBLE FORMAT

The response may contain line breaks, but must follow exactly this format:

[day 1 message] |
[day 3 message] |
[day 7 message]

That is:

Each message may have multiple paragraphs or line breaks.

The character | must be at the end of message 1 and at the end of message 2.

Message 3 MUST NOT end with |.

Nothing before and nothing after the three messages.

Length

Total between 150 and 200 words.

Each message must have 50 to 70 words.


Professional, empathetic and natural tone

Personalize candidate name, age (if available) and job title

No HTML

No emojis

No sensitive data

No guarantees of approval

Sign only if the company name is provided

Mandatory self-validation

Before sending, verify internally:

The response contains exactly two pipes, each one at the end of message 1 and 2.

The language needs to be (EN-US)

Each message has real content.

There is no text after the third message.

Total of 150 to 200 words per message.

Make the format of thhe message well written for e-mails

There is nothing besides the three messages.

If any rule fails, rewrite internally until you are 100% correct.

parameters.content:
## Day 1 Sending 
This group sends the Day 1 nurturing message immediately through WhatsApp (**Evolution API**) and Gmail.
The merge node ensures both channels process the correct next message.

## Day 3 Sending
After a 2-day wait, the workflow delivers the Day 3 message via WhatsApp and Gmail and merges outputs for consistency.

## Day 7 Sending
After a 4-day delay, the workflow sends the final nurturing message.
The last node simply ends the execution without additional actions.
